definitions.definition: To move (something broad and loose) up and down .
examples: The crow slowly flapped its wings.
Startled, the wood pigeon flew off, its wings flapping noisily.

definitions.definition: To move loosely back and forth .
examples: The flag flapped in the breeze.

definitions.definition: To pronounce (something) as a flap consonant .
To be pronounced with a flap consonant .
To be advertised as being available and then unavailable (or available by different routes ) in rapid succession.
labels: of a resource or network destination
definitions.label_groups: computing , telecommunications , intransitive , of a resource or network destination

main_definition: ( transitive ) To move (something broad and loose) up and down .
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive ) To move loosely back and forth .
( phonetics , transitive ) To pronounce (something) as a flap consonant .
( phonetics , intransitive ) To be pronounced with a flap consonant .

( computing , telecommunications , intransitive , of a resource or network destination ) To be advertised as being available and then unavailable (or available by different routes ) in rapid succession.
